definitions: holy city in central Iraq known for the shrine of Imam Hussein and as a major pilgrimage site for Shia Muslims
examples: Millions of pilgrims visit Karbala during Ashura ceremonies
The battle of Karbala shaped the course of Islamic history

definitions: member of a Finnic people living primarily in the Karelia region between Finland and Russia
Finnic language closely related to Finnish spoken in Karelia
examples: The Karelian heritage includes unique folk traditions and epic poetry
Many Karelian families were displaced during World War II
She studied Karelian to better understand her grandmother's native tongue
The differences between Karelian and Finnish are relatively minor

definitions: member of an ethnic group native to Myanmar and Thailand known for their distinct languages and cultural traditions
examples: The Karen people have maintained their traditional weaving techniques for centuries
Many Karen refugees have resettled in various countries worldwide

definitions: mountainous region in South Asia disputed between India, Pakistan, and China, known for its natural beauty and political conflict
examples: Kashmir has been called paradise on earth for its stunning landscapes
The Kashmir conflict has shaped regional politics for decades

definitions: person native to or living in the Kashmir region of South Asia
Indo-Aryan language spoken primarily in the Kashmir Valley with approximately seven million speakers
examples: The Kashmiri artisan created beautiful hand-woven carpets using traditional methods
Many Kashmiri families have businesses in the tourism industry
She learned Kashmiri to communicate with the local community
Kashmiri poetry has a rich literary tradition dating back centuries

definitions: thick flat piece of stone, concrete, or other hard material used in construction or as a surface
examples: The workers poured a concrete slab for the garage foundation
She placed the meat on a marble slab to keep it cool

definitions: loose or hanging part of a rope, wire, or similar material
period of reduced activity, demand, or business in work or commerce
examples: Pull the rope tight to remove any slack from the line
The climber carefully managed the slack in her safety rope
Business experiences slack during the summer vacation months
The factory hired temporary workers to cover the slack period

definitions: person who avoids work or effort and fails to meet their responsibilities or potential
examples: The manager warned the slacker about his poor work performance
Don't be a slacker when the team needs everyone's contribution

definitions: downhill ski race in which competitors navigate between poles or gates arranged in a zigzag pattern
examples: She won the gold medal in the giant slalom competition
The slalom course challenged even the most experienced skiers

definitions: false spoken statement that damages someone's reputation, distinguished from libel which is written defamation
examples: The politician sued his opponent for slander after the debate
Spreading slander about coworkers can result in serious legal consequences

definitions: informal language consisting of words and expressions not considered standard in the speaker's dialect or language
examples: Teenagers often use slang that confuses their parents
The dictionary added several new slang terms this year

definitions: slope or incline from a horizontal or vertical line
particular point of view or bias in presenting information
examples: The roof had a steep slant to help snow slide off
She adjusted the slant of her drawing board for comfort
The article had a political slant favoring the incumbent
Each newspaper puts its own slant on the story

definitions: comedy style based on exaggerated physical actions, falls, and mishaps designed to provoke laughter
examples: The old slapstick comedies featured elaborate chase scenes and pratfalls
Charlie Chaplin was a master of slapstick humor

definitions: long cut or stroke made with a sharp instrument at an angle
forward-leaning diagonal line (/) used as punctuation or to indicate alternatives
examples: The vandal left a deep slash across the painting
She made a quick slash with her sword during practice
Write and/or to show both options using a slash
The date was written as 12/25/2024 with slashes

definitions: horror film subgenre featuring a killer who stalks and murders victims with bladed weapons
person or tool that cuts or slashes materials violently or repeatedly
examples: The new slasher movie broke box office records last weekend
Classic slasher films often follow predictable plot patterns
The sugarcane slasher worked efficiently through the field
They hired a brush slasher to clear the overgrown lot

definitions: thin narrow piece of wood, metal, or plastic used in blinds, beds, or fences
examples: One slat in the window blind was broken and needed replacement
The bed frame uses wooden slats to support the mattress

definitions: fine-grained gray rock that splits into flat sheets used for roofing and writing surfaces
list of candidates proposed for election or appointment to positions
examples: The old schoolhouse still had slate tiles on its roof
Students once wrote on small slate boards with chalk
The party announced its slate of candidates for the election
She was included on the slate for board membership

definitions: killing of animals for food in a systematic or commercial manner
brutal killing of many people or animals in a violent and cruel way
examples: The cattle were taken to the facility for humane slaughter
Ancient rituals sometimes involved the slaughter of livestock
The battle resulted in the senseless slaughter of thousands
Historians documented the slaughter during the civil war

definitions: building where animals are killed and processed for meat production under regulated conditions
examples: The slaughterhouse follows strict health and safety regulations
Workers at the slaughterhouse wear protective equipment at all times

definitions: person who legally owned enslaved people as property, particularly in historical contexts before abolition
examples: The slaveholder owned a large plantation with hundreds of enslaved workers
Many slaveholders resisted the abolition movement until the Civil War

definitions: ship used to transport enslaved people, especially during the Atlantic slave trade
saliva drooling from the mouth, especially of animals or when someone is ill
examples: The slaver carried hundreds of captives across the Atlantic Ocean
Museums display artifacts recovered from sunken slaver ships
The dog's slaver dripped onto the floor while watching us eat
The patient's medication caused excessive slaver as a side effect

definitions: person who kills another, especially in a violent manner or as depicted in fantasy contexts
examples: The dragon slayer became a hero in medieval legends
Police searched for the slayer who had terrorized the community

definitions: act of killing someone or something violently, often used in dramatic or fantasy contexts
examples: The slaying of the monster saved the village from destruction
Detectives investigated the mysterious slaying downtown last night

definitions: quality of being sordid, corrupt, or morally degraded, especially in politics or business
examples: The scandal exposed the sleaze in local government operations
Tabloid newspapers often focus on celebrity sleaze and gossip

definitions: vehicle on runners for traveling over snow, pulled by dogs, horses, or used for sliding downhill
examples: The children took turns riding the sled down the snowy hill
The explorer used a dog sled to cross the Arctic wilderness

definitions: activity of riding a sled, especially as recreation on snowy hills
examples: The park was perfect for sledding after the overnight snowfall
Sledding requires proper winter clothing to stay warm and dry

definitions: heavy sled used for transporting loads over snow or ice
large heavy hammer with a long handle used for heavy work
examples: The expedition team loaded supplies onto the sledge for transport
Reindeer pulled the heavy sledge across the frozen tundra
He swung the sledge to drive the fence posts into the ground
Breaking concrete requires a sledge and protective equipment

definitions: large heavy hammer with a long handle used for breaking things or driving in stakes
examples: The demolition crew used a sledgehammer to break through the wall
Sometimes negotiations require finesse rather than a sledgehammer approach

definitions: person who is sleeping or a sleeping compartment on a train
horizontal beam supporting railway tracks
person or thing that achieves unexpected success after initial obscurity
examples: The sleeper stirred when the alarm clock rang loudly
We booked a sleeper car for the overnight train journey
Workers replaced the old wooden sleepers with concrete ones
The railway sleepers needed regular inspection for safety
The film was a sleeper hit at the box office
She turned out to be a sleeper candidate in the election

definitions: state of rest in which the eyes are closed and consciousness is suspended
examples: Sleeping for eight hours helps maintain good health
The baby finally stopped crying and began sleeping peacefully

definitions: person who walks or performs other activities while asleep, experiencing a parasomnia sleep disorder
examples: The sleepwalker had no memory of leaving the house at night
Parents installed locks to keep their sleepwalker child safe

definitions: parasomnia involving walking or performing complex behaviors while in a state of sleep
examples: His sleepwalking episodes became more frequent during stressful periods
Sleepwalking can be dangerous if the person leaves the house

definitions: precipitation consisting of ice pellets formed when rain freezes before reaching the ground
examples: The sleet made driving conditions extremely hazardous this morning
We heard sleet hitting the windows during the winter storm

definitions: vehicle on runners drawn by horses or reindeer for transportation over snow
examples: The sleigh ride through the snowy forest was magical
Santa's sleigh appears in countless Christmas stories and songs

definitions: use of dexterity or cunning to deceive, especially in performing magic tricks
examples: The magician's sleight of hand amazed the audience
Through sleight of logic, he convinced them of his argument

definitions: detective or person who investigates crimes or mysteries, often used informally
examples: The amateur sleuth solved the mystery before the police arrived
Online sleuths helped identify the suspect using social media

definitions: large number or quantity of something, used informally to indicate abundance
examples: A slew of complaints flooded the customer service department
She received a slew of job offers after graduating

definitions: action of cutting something into thin pieces or sections with a sharp instrument
examples: The chef demonstrated proper slicing technique for vegetables
Careful slicing ensures even cooking of the ingredients

definitions: smooth, wet, slippery surface, especially one covered with oil or similar substance
having a smooth, polished, and superficially attractive or professional quality
examples: The oil slick spread across the water after the spill
Rain created a dangerous slick on the highway
The company's slick marketing campaign impressed potential investors
His slick presentation style masked the lack of substance

definitions: small sandwich typically made with a soft bun
baseball pitch that curves laterally as it approaches the batter
control mechanism that moves along a track to adjust settings
examples: We ordered a platter of beef sliders for the party
The restaurant's specialty sliders come with various toppings
The pitcher's slider fooled the batter completely
He practiced throwing his slider during warm-ups
Adjust the volume using the slider on the screen
The slider controls the brightness of the display

definitions: thick, slippery liquid substance, often unpleasant, produced by various organisms or materials
examples: The snail left a trail of slime across the sidewalk
Children love playing with colorful slime as a sensory activity

definitions: strap or band used to support an injured arm or carry objects
weapon for hurling stones consisting of a strap with a pouch
examples: The doctor put his broken arm in a sling for support
She used a baby sling to carry her infant
David defeated Goliath with a stone from his sling
Ancient warriors were skilled with the sling and stone

definitions: person who uses a sling weapon or someone who throws or hurls objects
examples: The ancient slinger could hit targets from remarkable distances
The hash slinger at the diner worked the breakfast shift

definitions: Y-shaped stick with elastic band for shooting small stones or projectiles
examples: The boy used his slingshot to knock cans off the fence
Making a slingshot was a common childhood craft project

definitions: knot that forms an adjustable loop that tightens when pulled
examples: He tied a slipknot to create an adjustable lasso
The slipknot made it easy to secure the rope quickly

definitions: failure to maintain position or rate of progress, often referring to decline or loss
examples: The project experienced slippage in meeting its deadline
Market slippage affected the company's quarterly profits

definitions: soft comfortable shoe worn indoors, typically without fastenings
examples: She put on her fuzzy slippers after getting home from work
The hotel provided complimentary slippers for all guests

definitions: long narrow cut or opening in something
examples: Light entered through a small slit in the curtains
The envelope had a slit for inserting coins
